profiles:
Summary Senior software engineer with a proven record of system analysis, design, and development, with an expertise in object-oriented software development using Java/C++. Passionate about agile software development practices and quality improvement through the effective use of knowledge, information, and communication. Background includes strong knowledge of enterprise software development with Java, as well as experience of front-end development with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Experience in both development (7 years) and testing (2 years). Experience Software Engineer in Test Google January 2015  – Present (8 months) Shanghai City, China Drive the test strategy and developing automation tests and test tools for internal tools. Senior Software Development Engineer Intel Corporation April 2008  –  January 2015  (6 years 10 months) Shanghai City, China Responsible for developing Intel data center management software, and also a tester at early stage of the project. 
 
Key achievements: 
•	Successfully delivered product Intel DCM SDK, Intel DCM: Energy Director, Intel DCM: Virtual KVM Gateway, and Dell OpenManage Power Center to customers with team as a key developer. 
•	Designed and implemented project to get latency data from NICs, create application topology, and track performance issues. The project was selected as a demo project at Intel Design and Test Technology Conference 2013. 
•	Designed and implemented module to discover daily power utilization pattern of servers in data center, a highlight feature of Intel DCM: Energy Director. The feature was showed at Intel Software Professionals Conference 2013. 
•	Implemented and maintained module to distribute power to a group of servers. 
•	Designed and implemented module to deal with inaccuracy problem of Intel Node Manage version 1.5. 
•	Implemented front-end modules to manage devices and groups, power profiles and power estimator. 
•	Implemented prove of concept with other teams, and co-authored a chapter in book Creating the Infrastructure for Cloud Computing (Intel Press) during one of the PoCs. 
•	As a tester, defined bug management process for the team, designed and implemented test framework to switch between 2 different sets of APIs seamlessly, and successfully delivered Intel Node Manager simulator with team. Software Development Engineer in Test Intel Corporation April 2006  –  March 2008  (2 years) Shanghai City, China Responsible for designing and implementing tests for network module, designing and implementing automation framework of an Intel security product. 
Key achievements: 
•	Designed automation framework, built the 3-level structure for scripts, developed GUI tool, and developed infrastructure scripts for the framework. The automation framework greatly improved team’s execution efficiency, and is still used in one of the project at Intel. 
•	Led a team of 2 interns to automate basic acceptance tests, which were used as daily tests in PRC and as check in tests in Israel team. 
•	Defined test cases for network module, developed new test tool for OID test, re-wrote and added many features to an old test tool which was widely used in network test. Software Development Engineer Intern Intel Corporation May 2005  –  March 2006  (11 months) Shanghai City, China Responsible for server side development, server side performance turning, and customer support of an e-learning software. 
 
Key achievements: 
•	Designed and implemented server side module to reset user’s password. 
•	Designed and Implemented tools to import content to servers. 
•	Successfully built server cluster based on LVS. Software Engineer in Test Google January 2015  – Present (8 months) Shanghai City, China Drive the test strategy and developing automation tests and test tools for internal tools. Summary I am a Hardware/Software Engineer in a Validation Tools Group at Intel, involved in the support of the many Intel Silicon generation from SoC, client, servers. I am passionate about finding new and generic debug methodologies and/or techniques, to ease up debug-ability, testability at its different level to cut down validation time on the ever-growing SoC integration complexities and challenges. Summary I am a Hardware/Software Engineer in a Validation Tools Group at Intel, involved in the support of the many Intel Silicon generation from SoC, client, servers. I am passionate about finding new and generic debug methodologies and/or techniques, to ease up debug-ability, testability at its different level to cut down validation time on the ever-growing SoC integration complexities and challenges. Experience Software Development Engineer in Test Intel Corporation November 2014  – Present (10 months) Redmond, Bellevue WA - Developing comprehensive suite of automation test plan and test cases for windows mobile devices tablets and phones. 
- maintaining and adding to existing automation framework. 
- Development of toolset to augment QA and development testing. 
- Extend automation library and framework. 
- Pasion in finding bottlenecks in existing code through the use of automation tools. 
 
 Hardware/Test Engineer Intel Corporation January 2006  – Present (9 years 8 months) DuPont, WA Validation Engineer - Drove system requirement to port Silicon RTL component into an emulation environment. Guided Silicon developers to overcome common timing constrains and routing gotchas. Drove test strategy and plan. Worked with BIOS and security team to build up code reference recipes to enable closed chassis debug feature on Intel silicon in the client and SOC space. Worked with Silicon debug developers, from different silicon teams, to enable DFX feature based on customer’s debug needs and tools perspective. Worked with silicon designers to debug signal handshaking, platform events (reset, power state…), and tracing register state values using JTAG protocol and other Intel proprietary bus protocol. Led a small SW developer team to expand a debug capability and usability by driving requirements, inspecting designs, providing guidance, instructions and leadership to shape up a tangible delivery.  
Developed Test plan & strategy documents, provided design solution for test infrastructure development. 
Developed framework infrastructure libraries in python to drive test contents for manual test debug and automation.  
 
FPGA designer using Xillinx FPGA families- extracted requirements, delivered FPGA design solution to meet minimum fundamental requirement such as cost and area. Went through FPGAs design cycle and phases, from RTL to timing driven synthesis to place & route, static timing analysis. Expert using Verilog and systemVerilog to model HW RTL. Experience using Logic analyzer, Xillinx chipscope, Lead and Design creator for HW integration test content and infrastructure. Summary * ~2 years experience in WebApi service development and testing based on Windows Azure Platform 
* Over 7 years experience in mobile web browser testing, including Chrome and Fennec; Fundamental knowledge of Web Layout Engines, and compliance test suites, including HTML5, CSS, DOM, XML, AJAX, Gecko, Webkit, W3C Conformance Test Suites, ACID 2 & 3, Location-Based technologies, including Geoclue, Geo-Location API in HTML5 
* Experience in automation framework design and implementation for API and Web UI testing, including CppUnit, Nunit, JUnit, TestNG, Selenium IDE & WebDriver  
* Rich experience in testing tools and system for bugs tracking, test case management and quality metrics, including Bugzilla, TestLink, Enterprise-Tester, Klocwork-Insight

•	Investigate effective and performance efficient solutions, develop high-quality features based on Windows Azure Platform 
•	Coordinate cross-team communication, collect feedbacks from customers on feature design and development, gain buy-in from all stakeholders throughout customers, development and management teams. 
•	Ensure high-quality functionality of Localization service, design and automate unit/component/functional testing, measure key performance metrics and resolve performance issues. Drive functional and performance test planning, development and automation of localization features. Provide regular reporting and prompt feedback on test issues and quality status to ensure high-quality deliverables Software Development Engineer in Test II Microsoft May 2013  –  July 2014  (1 year 3 months) Shanghai City, China Windows Azure Commerce Platform Sr Software Development Engineer in Test Intel Corporation March 2009  –  April 2012  (3 years 2 months) Functional and non-functional test planning, test case design and implementation for system and key applications of Intel MeeGo/Tizen system on Netbook/Handset platforms 
 
* Design model-based system-level test plan focusing on mobile contexts and multi-tasking scenarios for MeeGo/Tizen Netbook/Handset mobile platforms, covering Web-Surfing, Telephony, Communication, Productivity, Multi-media, PIM, Social-Networking and System management categories. 
 
* Work closely with developers to test Firefox and Chrome-based Web-Browser for Moblin Netbook/Handset platforms, including feature testability review, test plan design and implementation, automate testing with Mozilla-XulRunner and Selenium-WebDriver API framework. 
 
* Design and implement structural test cases of Geoclue library for Moblin/Netbook platform. Automate testing with GTester framework 
 
* Created functional and UI test design guidelines for all applications in MeeGo covering generic test points, test conditions and checklists 
 
* Design generic checklists of touch UI layout and behaviors based on investigating UX design principles of competitor companies and research group. 
 
* Design and coordinate UX user experience evaluation for MeeGo system, and delivered UX quality summary reports. 
 
* Setup and maintain Klocwork server, and conduct project-wide code scanning and metrics; Coordinate test case and test plan reviewing as leader role for all applications in MeeGo system Software Development Engineer in Test Intel Corporation October 2008  –  March 2009  (6 months) Functional testing of Open Source Virtual Machine Xen on IPF platform 
 
* Independently accomplished testing for Xen on IPF platform, including functional test case design and implementation, bug tracking and test reporting. Automated daily nightly testing. 
 
* Significantly contributed to Xen/IPF booting-up on Intel Montecito platform by closely co-working with developers in global working environment on booting configuration, instructions, and troubleshooting Software Engineer in Test Intel Corporation August 2004  –  September 2008  (4 years 2 months) Functional and non-functional testing of LBS application: Intel® Local Toolbar and Intel® Location Technology SDK 
 
* validation and verification for Intel® Local Toolbar product on WindowXP/Vista/WinCE platform, covering functionalities, performance, memory leak, features/code coverage measurements and legal reviewing. Automate regression testing with .NET 3.0 UI Automation API 
 
* validation and verification of Intel® Location Technology SDK product; independently design class/integration/GUI test cases in C++, C# and Perl on Windows & Linux platforms. 
 
* design & implementation of a cross-platforms test automation frameworks based on CppUnit/JUnit/NUnit with Cpp/Java/C# language, covering test configuration, execution and reporting 
 
* QA/release processes setup, adoption and improvements for project.
